comments.content: I absolutely agree with you. I also go with vpc 2. But technically it is also possible to use vpc 200.

discussion.content:
SHOULDN'T BE 
VPC 2?
VPC number needs to be same on both sides and can be any number; BUT since we have no idea of which is the VPC member number is used on the other side and by DEFAULT if the vpc number isnt specified it is assigned the same number as the portc-channel number in this case 2.

So I will use 2 instead of 200 for last box

Page 98
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/design/vpc_design/vpc_best_practices_design_guide.pdf
Provided solution is correct
I have done configuration a lot of times. Its D for sure.

Selected Answer: D
allocation must be dynamic
I think it should be D. This is a normal behavior for VMM integration.
answer is D

An answer is should be D.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/dcn/whitepapers/cisco-application-centric-infrastructure-design-guide.html#_Toc129073492

Correct

comments.content: Not true - static VLAN pools can be used with VMM. Not usual I agree, but not impossible. In fact Q says "requirement is to assign VLAN" so I think it could be A as with dynamic you (the user) doesn't get to assign the VLAN, the APIC picks it instead.
can't be A. As already mentioned VMM domain which is necessary for vmware integration can only use dynamic vlan pools

questions.question_text: An engineer must integrate Cisco ACI with a VMware vSphere environment. The requirement is to use a VMware Distributed Virtual Switch and to assign the encapsulation VLAN of the EPG from the VLAN pool. Which configuration set accomplishes this goal?

choices.B:
Create a physical domain association under the EPGs.
Create a VLAN pool with dynamic allocated VLANs.
choices.A:
Create a VMM domain association under the EPGs.
Create a VLAN pool with static allocated VLANs.
choices.D:
Create a VMM domain association under the EPGs.
Create a VLAN pool with dynamic allocated VLANs.
choices.C:
Create a physical domain association under the EPGs.
Create a VLAN pool with static allocated VLANs.

questions.question_text: Which two actions are needed to configure a single Cisco APIC controller for Cisco ACI fabric for the first time? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
I would say correct answer is C,D:

1.configure first APIC
2.register switches discovered by LLDP
Cant be A. All leafs and switches are found by APIC trough LLDP.
It is impossible to register switches when they are not connected. To Answer is CD

Selected Answer: AD
A,D looks correct.

The first APIC should be configured. 
Only the switches which are discovered can be registered.
CD is correct
CD - we dont need to discover all Leafs and Spines to configure the APIC

Selected Answer: AD
Correct Answer :

1. configure first APIC 
2. discovery and register nodes and fabric (Spine & Leaf)

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/white_papers/Cisco-ACI-Initial-Deployment-Cookbook.html

comments.content: You can onl register leaf and spine switches which are discovered via LLDP.

choices.C: Register the switches that are discovered through LLDP.
choices.D: Configure the first Cisco APIC controller.
choices.A: Register all leaf and spine switches.
choices.B: Register the APIC that is connected to the switch.
choices.E: Configure the leaf switch where the Cisco APIC is connected, using CLI to allow APIC connectivity.

discussion.content:
D is correct

A. CLI-based scripting: This approach involves writing scripts to extract data from network devices through their command-line interfaces (CLIs). While it can be used for data retrieval, it's not as scalable or real-time as streaming telemetry.

B. Logging: Logging typically involves storing log data generated by network devices. While it can provide valuable information, it is not inherently a real-time push model and may not meet the requirement for close to real-time access to operational data.

C. SNMPv3: SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol) is a widely used protocol for monitoring and managing network devices. SNMPv3 does support data retrieval, but it relies on a pull model (where the monitoring system requests data from devices) rather than a push model, which may not provide as close to real-time access as streaming telemetry does.

Selected Answer: D
d is correct

questions.question_text: A network architect wants to propose a scalable network monitoring solution in which data is repeatedly acquired from network devices. The solution must use a push model and provide close to real-time access to operational data. Which technology must be used to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
APM supports ERSPAN. This will be ERSPAN destination. We need source session from switch. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3850/software/release/16-3/configuration_guide/b_163_consolidated_3850_cg/b_163_consolidated_3850_cg_chapter_01001010.pdf

Selected Answer: C
erspan session is configured on the root tree CLI, no inside a interface.
CCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCCC

Agree with C, snippet of a ERSPAN config at source:

monitor session 1 type erspan-source
 erspan-id 2
 vrf TEST
 destination ip 1.1.1.1
 source vlan 12 both
 no shut

questions.question_text: An engineer implements an Application Performance Monitoring (APM) solution. The solution runs in a vSphere infrastructure where the vSwitch support for promiscuous mode is disabled for security reasons. As a result, the final implementation must receive a copy of bidirectional traffic to a load balancer that is connected to a Cisco Nexus 93108 Series Switch. The APM solution supports GRE encapsulated traffic. Which configuration must be applied to the switch to meet this requirement?

choices.A:
interface vlan1
switchport monitor
destination ip 10.1.1.1
exit
monitor session 1 rx
monitor session 1 tx
source interface ethernet1/9
choices.B:
monitor session 1 both
source interface ethernet 1/9
destination interface ethernet 1/12
erspan-id 1
vrf mgmt0
filter vlan 3
no shut
choices.D:
interface ethernet 1/9
erspan-id 1
monitor session 1 type erspan-source
interface mgmt0
monitor session 1 type erspan-destination
destination ip 10.1.1.1
no shut
choices.C:
configure terminal
monitor session 1 type erspan-source
erspan-id 1
destination ip 10.1.1.1
source interface ethernet 1/9 both
vrf default
no shut
